title: Customized Math Education Technology Strategies for Children with Special Needs: Strengthening Calculation, Geometry, and Measurement Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (operations, geometry, measurement) and experience using digital devices. Familiarity with voice-command-based formula input functions within platforms
context.additional_context: Mixed-class environment including students with special educational needs (visual/hearing impairments and functional difficulties). Teachers monitor individual progress, proficiency levels, and error patterns via personalized learning platforms, supporting them with probability/statistics visualization tools and geometric shape manipulation features.

learning_goals: Students with special educational needs achieve over 80% proficiency in foundational math skills (calculation, geometry, measurement) using a personalized learning platform.
Learners independently operate platform accessibility features (screen readers, voice commands, zoom tools) with 90% accuracy and utilize formula input and graph interpretation functions.

Students analyze three or more error types (e.g., equation-solving mistakes, omitted geometric proofs, failed statistical data interpretation) based on monthly formative assessment results and revise and implement personalized learning strategies (e.g., concept review, problem-solving reinforcement, visual aids) within two weeks.

Teachers use platform analytics tools (learning data visualization, error pattern tracking) to establish and apply customized feedback strategies (e.g., step-by-step problem-solving guides, proof-process emphasis) for individual learners.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
